page.title: 01AN AREA OF THE BLACK COUNTRY
page.content: Industrial development and re-development have fashioned much of this area over the last few centuries. Land once used for industries like brick and tile manufacturing, for chain and nail making and for mining (both deep and open-cast) is now being re-developed to provide modern housing estates which, together with blocks of flats, established areas of old terraced dwellings, Edwardian and Victorian houses comprise the major portion of our 12 sq.km grid. The whole area is made up of small inter-linked communities, such as {Brockmoor, Wordsley}and{Amblecote,}all of which have been severely affected by factory closures and unemployment. However the glass industries at {Wordsley}and{Brierley Hill}continue to flourish and provide a tourist attraction.
